Title: Adjust default camera brightness settings?
Content:
The Samsung camera on my S22+ is great, but I find that it tends to be overly bright and washes out most details on any picture, whether it's in bright sunlight or in dark night settings. I always end up having to manually adjust the brightness down before snapping the picture, which has made me miss the shot many times. I've tried simply adjusting the brightness in the photo editor after taking the picture but it has the same washed out quality. 
Is there a way to just permanently set the camera brightness to a lower level so Al the picture I take are lower brightness? Thanks for any help!

Title: Galaxy A52 too S22U Camera Questions about Macro Mode...
Content: I owned quite a few mid-range Samsung phones and before upgrading my latest was the Galaxy A52 and if you go into camera, there's a dedicated macro mode on the A52. On my new S22 Ultra I expected to find the same modes but to my surprise there is no macro mode on the S22 Ultra. I did a little digging, and it seems you need to go to use the telephoto lens with the S22. Does anyone know anymore information about this? Why is there no dedicated macro mode for the new Samsungs? Was there an actual dedicated macro camera on the lower end A52? Thank you for your responses!

Title: Should I buy the S22+?
Content:
I know the S23 series is right around the corner but I'm honestly underwhelmed.

I think the S21/S22 was peak design. Samsung's camera island was a neat concept that dealt with the issue of growing camera sensors, only for them to ditch it after two generations and replace it with imo a generic-looking alternative. The Galaxy series doesn't look much different to Samsung's midrange line now. Perhaps this is some strategy for Samsung to homogenize their design language but it cheapens the flagship experience (although arguably only the Ultra models are true flagships now). Not to mention, the new camera format offers less protection to the lenses.  

Also, it's been rumoured that the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 in the new S23 is an overclocked version from Samsung foundries, not TSMC, which likely means same old thermal throttling/overheating issues. So, it's not as if the S23 line is even offering a better user experience.

Finally, I'm a big fan of white tech. Most of my other devices are all in glorious white. For some it's plain and boring, but I love the simplicity and cleanness of it. It doesn't appear that the S23 models will come in white this year. Samsung have adopted for chewed up bubblegum colours instead.

With that in mind, is it worth buying the S22 Plus at discount?

Title: Charging issue
Content: I got the phone back in October, and for the last month or so I've been experiencing charging issues. Sometimes the phone won't even recognize that a cord is plugged in, but the rest of the time it only allows slow charging. I also notice that when the cord is plugged in solidly, the whole port moves if I wiggle the cord.  Does the port need to be replaced? The phone isn't even 4 months old yet.

Title: How to reduce heat from playing H.265 codec videos?
Content:
When I watch videos with h.265 codecs on my base s22 using VLC player, it gets hot and drains battery even more crazily than usual. No different on MX player. 

Are there any tips to try and minimize this? I've got hardware acceleration turned on (if this even makes a difference, which it doesn't seem to). Thanks.

Title: Samsung ROM via Odin
Content:
Hey guys,



I used to have a S9+ that I bought at my carrier. It came with a lot of bloatware (ZTM rom), so I used Odin to flash the stock Samsung ROM (ZTO) and worked like a charm.

Today I bought a new S22 at the same carrier, and the first thing I did was to flash the ZTO firmware on it, but it didn't work like the last time. I'm still on the ZTM rom after all the process.

Did something change with the new phones or is there something I should've done?

thanks :)

Title: Bluetooth notification sounds
Content: Does anyone else experience the issue where, when connected to certain Bluetooth devices (for me its when connected to my car's Bluetooth only), and you receive a notification (like an SMS), a loud chime sound plays? This constantly disrupts my music that is playing and after the chime plays my music starts, then stops for a second, then plays again. Setting my phone to Do Not Disturb or even notifications on Mute doesn't seem to fix it. I also tried different SMS apps but they all do the same thing.

Title: S22 Ultra Voicemail Problems with Verizon
Content: In order to check my voicemail, I have the only option of dialing * 86. I have reset my phone, clear the cache and data for my phone and voicemail apps. Still, I am not able to be notified of my voicemails on my phone.
